climbs.name: La Raie
climbs.fa: Damien Côté & François Bédard (2010), FFA: Julien Bourassa-Moreau (2020)

content.description:
This might by one of the finest crack climb in the Northeast. Though the crux isn't crack climbing itseft, more like faceclimbing between cracks, it is truly an amazing piece of rock.

P1 (5.8) - Climb an easy first pitch that could see a little cleaning. Trend left following an obvious crack system.

P2 (5.14a or A1) - Climb 5.12 fingers until the cracks dissspear then boulder (crux) between 2 seams to gain another crack left and finish with 5.12 finger.



The obvious overhanging crack that splits the headwall.

Mostly finger size pieces

To the left of THE offwidth and about two-thirds of the way width of the cliff is a huge rocky outcrop characteristic rectangular. Its shape vaguely evokes a Totem. It is located under a huge pine tree at the top of the cliff. Between this Totem pole and the Jupiter Offwidth is the central section of Tomahawk with its large smooth wall and slightly overhanging (5 m by 70 m high).
